metadata.title: CVE-2023-1195 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in reconn_set_ipaddr_from_hostname infs/cifs/connect.c in the Linux kernel. The issue occurs when it forgets toset the free pointer server->hostname to NULL, leading to an invalidpointer request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1195` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-99-generic - 5.4.0-99.112
linux-image-5.4.0-99-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-99.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-99-generic - 5.4.0-99.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-99-lowlatency - 5.4.0-99.112
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic - 5.15.0-67.74~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-67.74~20.04.1
